about_the_game:
Find the truth at the end of the world

Decide the fate of an ageless cosmic war as humanity clings to its existence trapped in a metal dome.

An innovative horror-adventure experience set in a gnarled and broken Canada. Explore desolate locations, tangle with a dangerous gang and see through the universe as Max, a mechanic searching for the truth in Nakusp City.

Humanity's final resting place

Life // Blood takes place in Nakusp City, the last bastion for humanity on a mysteriously desolate planet earth.
Years into a dystopian future, the last humans have banded together to protect from the outside horrors and await the end of the world.


Life // Blood begins as Max attends a job like any other, where he is confronted with an unexpected new companion and a dark new mystery.

Fix a Broken City

Use Max's mechanical expertise and a host of psychic abilities to go where you shouldn't be, and listen to what you shouldn't hear. Repair machines, read minds, and solve mysteries.

Trapped in Metal

Dive deep into the bowels of the horrifying Nakusp City, hidden under a huge metal dome.
Dangerous streets and a cold twisting undercity inhabited by broken citizens and a ruthless criminal organization hide a dark truth.

Don't Trust Your Eyes

Uncover a epic cinematic tale about addiction, gender identity, and blood. A surreal and disturbing tale, inspired by classic Lovecraftian horror, and cinematic legends such as Ari Aster, Jordan Peele, and David Cronenberg.

Unmatched atmosphere

Experience a surreal nightmare with beautiful low-poly 3d environments and detail rich pixel art characters,
complimented by dynamic lighting, elegant camera movement and stunning 1-bit cutscenes tell a story like none other.

content_descriptors.notes: This Game may contain content not appropriate for all ages, or may not be appropriate for viewing at work: Frequent Violence or Gore, General Mature Content.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-2300 or AMD FX-4350
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTS 450 (1GB) or AMD Radeon HD 6570 (1GB)
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: 16:9 monitor recommended
